f2cf4b00-8547-4c46-b37a-7bd215199214.description: This individual has passed the Certification of The BCI examination which is based upon the BCI Good Practice Guidelines (GPG) 2018 Edition. The BCI Good Practice Guidelines is the definitive guide for business continuity and resilience professionals seeking the fundamentals to implement a Business Continuity Management (BCM) programme into an organisation. The GPG is globally recognised as the go-to publication for good practice.

854c79ab-afc7-40db-805e-7a4055845997.description: This individual has been awarded CBCI membership of The BCI. CBCI membership provides a solid base for a career in business continuity and resilience and holders are encouraged to upgrade to AMBCI or MBCI.

0e585d9c-2d16-42b0-bc82-2e79bdd04b0e.description: This individual has been awarded Member of The BCI, who define the competencies required to build workplace capability and resilience. Members are assessed upon their skills to prove they have a comprehensive understanding of the subject. Members can analyse and evaluate complex information and can apply this in their day-to-day work to solve problems. Their contribution supports employers develop resilience capability and gives society confidence in the resilience profession.

63da0c93-9092-4029-9a46-ab4f18f335c9.description: This individual has been awarded Associate Membership of The BCI who define the competencies required to build workplace capability and resilience. Associate Members can apply this in their day-to-day work to carry out well defined tasks that are sometimes non-routine and complex.

c681b847-c72f-4437-9cd6-9dd04cffd1df.description: This individual has been awarded Fellowship of The BCI who define the competencies required to build workplace capability and resilience. Fellows are assessed upon their significant voluntary contribution made to The BCI and/or the wider community and their skills to prove they have an advanced understanding of the subject. They can reformulate or develop original thinking to build and improve organisational resilience, and/or apply advanced understanding to solve complex problems.

badge_template_activities.title: This individual previously held MBCI or AFBCI status and was able to evidence Advanced competency against 6 BCI competencies. This individual has also been continuously giving back to the wider BC community, and/or The BCI over the past 5 years and continues to do so going forward. This contribution is voluntary and outside any paid role.

OR - This individual applied under the Experiential Route and supplied evidence of Comprehensive competency against 5 BCI competencies AND evidence of Advanced competency against the remaining 6 BCI competencies. This individual has also been continuously giving back to the wider BC community, and/or The BCI over the past 5 years and continues to do so going forward. This contribution is voluntary and outside any paid role.
Fellows are encouraged to complete at least 20 hours of CPD each year to keep their knowledge and skill-set up to date. CPD is a mandatory requirement upon application to this grade.
